page.title: 13Keswick's Cottage Hospital
page.content: The Cottage Hospital is a small hospital and it is only used for people who are ill or have broken arms or legs.If you were about to have a baby you would have to go to a big hospital like Carlisle or Whitehaven.The busiest day in the hospital is a Saturday because schools are off and the children are playing around the market square.There are two stairs in the hospital.One of the stairs leads to the staffs rooms.The other leads to the physiotherapy.This is where they lift things to get their muscles working.Each day they have a good variety of food,and tea is at 3.30pm.In the kitchens they have a large fridge.In the hospital they have one floor for their work and they have an Xray room.They have no children's wards in this hospital.
